title: Turn Any Website Into Clean, Ready‑to‑Use Data — No Selectors, No Code. Start in 60 Seconds.
subtitle: Stop wrestling with brittle CSS selectors and manual copy‑paste. Just describe the data you want — product names, prices, reviews, tables, job listings — and our AI finds, extracts, and delivers it to your warehouse with accuracy, speed, and scale.

primaryCta.text: Start Free — Extract Your First Dataset Now

features.title: Describe it, don’t code it
features.description: Tell the AI what you need in plain English. “Grab product name, price, rating, and image URL.” It understands any layout and pulls exactly those fields — no CSS or XPath required.

features.title: Layout-proof extraction
features.description: Websites change. Your data shouldn’t. Our model adapts to new page structures automatically, reducing breakage and maintenance by up to 95%.

features.title: From raw web to analytics-ready
features.description: Normalize, deduplicate, and validate with built‑in ETL. Export clean data to CSV/JSON, webhooks, S3, BigQuery, Snowflake, or Google Sheets — no extra pipelines needed.

features.title: Scale without sweat
features.description: Browser automation, smart concurrency, retries, and rotating proxies keep your crawls fast and reliable — from a single page to millions per month.

features.title: Compliance and controls
features.description: Respect site rules with robots-aware crawling, rate limiting, and audit logs. Field‑level controls, PII redaction, and opt‑in allowlists give your team peace of mind.

features.title: Monitor, alert, and iterate
features.description: Track runs, accuracy, and coverage in one place. Get alerts on failures, review diffs, and refine instructions without redeploying code.

testimonials.quote: We replaced weeks of brittle selector work with a single instruction. Time‑to‑data dropped from days to hours.
testimonials.name: Maya R.
testimonials.title: Head of Growth

testimonials.quote: It handled dynamic pages and infinite scroll out of the box. Our team focuses on insights instead of babysitting scrapers.

testimonials.title: Lead Data Engineer

faqs.question: How do I tell the system what to extract?
faqs.answer: Type a natural‑language instruction (e.g., “Collect product title, price, rating, number of reviews, and image URL”) and optionally provide a schema. The AI identifies the right elements across different layouts and returns structured data.

faqs.question: Will it work on complex sites like SPAs or infinite scroll?
faqs.answer: Yes. We use real browser automation to render dynamic content, scroll when needed, click “next” or “load more,” and handle client‑side rendering common in modern SPAs.

faqs.question: Is web scraping legal and compliant?
faqs.answer: We focus on publicly available data and provide robots-aware crawling, rate limiting, and audit logs. You’re responsible for how you use the service and for complying with applicable laws and site terms. We provide controls to support compliant use, including allowlists and field‑level redaction.

faqs.question: How accurate is the AI extraction?
faqs.answer: The AI is trained to locate and structure fields reliably across varied layouts. We add validation, schema enforcement, and confidence checks. You can review samples, set required fields, and fail runs that don’t meet your quality thresholds.

faqs.question: How do you handle blocking and reliability?
faqs.answer: Rotating proxies, realistic browser behavior, smart retries, and concurrency controls keep runs stable. You can throttle by domain, set backoff strategies, and monitor success rates with alerts.

faqs.question: Do I need engineers to maintain this?
faqs.answer: No. Non‑technical users can launch and iterate using plain‑language instructions. Data teams can add schemas, transformations, and integrations when needed — without babysitting brittle selectors.

about: We built this platform to make web data accessible to everyone — not just engineers. Under the hood, it combines real browser automation with advanced AI (powered by Google Gemini) to find and extract the fields you care about, even as layouts change. Deployed on a battle‑tested runtime for massive scale (Apify), it turns messy web pages into dependable, analytics‑ready datasets. Our team has shipped data infrastructure for high‑growth startups and enterprises alike. We care about accuracy, reliability, and responsible data practices — so you can move faster with confidence.

visual_mood.overall_feeling: Trustworthy, innovative, and approachable—enterprise power without intimidation.
visual_mood.target_emotion: Confidence that anyone can extract reliable data in minutes, safely and at scale.

design.typography_style: Headings: Inter or Plus Jakarta Sans (700/800). Body: Inter (400–500). Code/UI: JetBrains Mono or IBM Plex Mono. Base size 16–18px (mobile 16, desktop 18) with 1.55–1.7 line-height; 8pt spacing system. Heading scale: H1 40–56, H2 32–40, H3 24–28. Use tabular numerals for metrics and pricing. Ensure 45–75 character line length, ample whitespace, and clear hierarchy. Maintain strong contrast for WCAG AA/AAA in both light and dark modes.
design.layout_approach:
- Above the fold: Single-line promise (“AI‑Powered Web Data Extraction”) + short subhead (outcomes, not features) + primary CTA (“Start free”) + secondary CTA (“See demo”) and a live ‘Try it now’ URL input/sandbox. Trust strip with recognizable logos.
- Segmentation for a general audience: a simple toggle or cards “No‑code” vs “Developer” that switches examples and CTAs (Workflow Builder vs API/SDKs). Keep copy plain-language; reveal complexity progressively.
- Core narrative (scan-friendly): 1) What it does (3‑step: Point → Extract → Deliver), 2) Where it works (sites, pagination, auth), 3) Outcomes (clean JSON/CSV to your data warehouse). Use iconography and short bullets.
- Screens/product proof: Crisp, real screenshots (masked data) with annotations; code samples with tabs (Python, JS, cURL). Show before→after (HTML → structured JSON) for credibility.
- Social proof & risk reversal: Ratings, testimonials, usage stats, uptime/SLA, compliance badges; free tier details (“no credit card”), transparent limits.
- Pricing: Three tiers + enterprise; monthly/annual toggle; highlight most popular. Clarify DaaS vs ETL usage. Include fair-usage notes and overage transparency.
- Docs & resources: Prominent Docs in nav, instant search, quickstarts by role. ‘Playground’ link. Comparison page vs common alternatives (manual scraping, other providers).
- IA & nav: Product, Solutions (by role/use case), Pricing, Docs, Integrations, Resources, Company. Persistent primary CTA in header. Sticky sub‑nav on long product pages.
- In‑app patterns: Jobs list with statuses, pipeline builder, connectors marketplace, run history/logs, monitors/alerts, scheduling (cron), retries, dedupe, PII handling, export destinations.
- Color psychology/utilization: Blue primary (trust/competence) for CTAs/links; purple secondary (AI/innovation) for highlights/gradients; green accent for success and confirmations. Use warm amber for warnings and red for errors (system colors). 60/30/10 distribution; maintain 4.5:1 contrast. Subtle blue→indigo gradient in hero for modern depth.
- Conversion focus: One dominant CTA per view, repeat inline CTAs after key sections, exit‑intent demo invite, frictionless signup (GitHub/Google), progressive profiling post‑activation, live chat or sales handoff for enterprise.
- Grid & responsiveness: 12‑col grid, max content width 1200–1280px, comfortable gutters. Mobile-first; keep critical CTAs visible; collapse code tabs to dropdown on small screens.
- Motion: Micro‑interactions (hover, press, skeleton loaders). Respect reduced‑motion preferences; avoid heavy parallax.
- Accessibility: WCAG 2.2 AA, visible focus states (3:1), keyboard navigable components, 44×44px targets, descriptive labels/alt text, error prevention and recovery, skip links, language attributes, accessible charts with table fallbacks.
design.imagery_style: Product-first. High-fidelity UI screenshots in both light and dark themes, with gentle depth and subtle gradient backgrounds. Vector illustrations of data pipelines (site → extractor → transform → destination) using the brand palette. Short animated clips or Lotties for steps (kept minimal). Code snippets with syntax highlighting and language tabs. Before/after callouts (raw HTML vs clean JSON/CSV). Integration logos in monochrome to avoid visual noise. Avoid generic ‘robot/AI’ cliché imagery; prefer tangible data flow visuals.
ui_elements: Primary CTA button (solid blue, large, rounded, high-contrast)
Secondary CTA (outlined/ghost, purple accent)
Role/Path selector (No-code vs Developer segmented control)
URL input with validation and sample dropdown (playground)
Interactive playground (extract sample page → preview JSON/CSV)
Code sample block with tabs (Python/JS/cURL) + copy-to-clipboard
API key manager with masked tokens and regen flow
Connectors/Integrations gallery (DW, DBs, lakes, webhooks)
Scheduler UI (cron presets + advanced)
Run history table with filters, status pills, and pagination
Log viewer with search, levels, and download
Alert rules (thresholds, channels: email/Slack/Webhook)
Data mapping/transform stepper (normalize, dedupe, schema)
Diff viewer for schema/version changes
Pricing toggle (monthly/annual) and usage meter
ROI/Time-saved mini calculator
Trust badges (uptime/SLA, SOC2/ISO as applicable)
Status/uptime indicator linked to status page
Onboarding checklist and product tour
Empty states with helpful actions and docs links
Skeleton loaders and optimistic toasts
Inline form validation with clear error text
Keyboard shortcuts and command palette (Cmd/Ctrl+K)
Search with typeahead across site and docs
Docs sidebar (sticky) + in-page TOC with anchor links
Breadcrumbs for docs/resources
Dark mode toggle with persisted preference
Language/locale switch (if global audience)
Cookie consent (minimal, compliant)
Accessibility helpers (skip link, focus visible, ARIA)
CSV/JSON/Parquet export buttons
Rate limit and usage indicators
Bulk URL upload (CSV) and sitemap import
Proxy/geolocation selector (if offered)
Legal/compliance notices for scraping ethics and robots.txt
Contact sales modal with calendar embed for demos

businessAnalysis.business_type: AI-powered web scraping/data extraction platform (Data-as-a-Service and ETL tooling)
businessAnalysis.target_audience: Businesses and professionals who need structured web data without heavy engineering effort—growth/marketing and sales ops teams, data analysts/researchers, product and competitive intelligence teams, e-commerce/pricing teams, and developers at startups to enterprises
businessAnalysis.business_model: Primarily B2B SaaS with self-serve onboarding; subscription + usage-based (credit/API call) pricing tiers, with optional enterprise plans/SLA
key_value_props: No-code scraping—usable by non-technical users (“a scraper for anyone”)
AI-driven auto-extraction and selector generation to reduce setup and maintenance
End-to-end stack (rendering, crawling, proxy management, CAPTCHA handling) for high success rates
Scalable and reliable data collection from dynamic/JavaScript-heavy sites
Scheduling, monitoring, and error handling for ongoing data pipelines
Prebuilt templates/recipes for common websites and use cases
Faster time-to-value vs building/maintaining custom scrapers in-house
competitive_advantages: AI-assisted extraction minimizes configuration and breakage vs traditional scrapers
Accessible UX for non-technical users while offering APIs/SDKs for engineers
Managed infrastructure (proxies, headless browsers, retries) reduces operational complexity
Elastic horizontal scaling and global IP pools for throughput and coverage
Data quality features (validation, deduplication, monitoring) for trustworthy datasets
Compliance-first posture with controls to respect site policies and privacy regulations
Flexible pricing (self-serve to enterprise) and quick deployment
